title: Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk Shooting Suspect, Went From Scholarship Winner to Wanted Man
summary: Tyler Robinson, the man accused of shooting Charlie Kirk, was a stellar student in high school, raised in a Republican home in Southwest Utah and training to be an electrician.

title: What Made Charlie Kirk Influential?

title: E.P.A. To Stop Collecting Emissions Data From Polluters
summary: The data, from thousands of coal-burning power plants, oil refineries, steel mills and other industrial facilities, is the country’s most comprehensive way to track greenhouse gases.

title: Man Fatally Shot in Confrontation With ICE Officers in Chicago Area
summary: The shooting took place during a federal crackdown on illegal immigration in the region. Officials said an ICE officer was dragged and injured.

title: Former Judge Sushila Karki Named Nepal’s Leader After Gen Z Protests
summary: Sushila Karki, a former chief justice, was the choice of the student protesters whose mass rallies led to violent clashes and toppled the government.

title: Is ‘The Pitt’ Really an ‘ER’ Spinoff? Michael Crichton’s Estate Says It Is.
summary: The estate of the best-selling author, which has intellectual property rights to “ER,” and the creators of the new hit TV show are waging a legal battle over whether it’s a stealth reboot.

title: Mamdani, if Elected Mayor, Pledges to Order N.Y.P.D. to Arrest Netanyahu
summary: Zohran Mamdani expanded on his vow to arrest Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, saying it would show that New York “stands up for international law.” Experts said the move would be impractical and likely illegal.

title: For the First Time in the Mayor’s Race, Cuomo Campaigns at a Mosque
summary: Andrew M. Cuomo, who has faced criticism for bypassing mosques as he seeks to become mayor, spoke of New York as a beacon of opportunity during an appearance in the Bronx.

title: Trump Says It Looks Like Mamdani Is ‘Going to Win’
summary: President Trump said on Friday that he believed Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, would win, likening that outcome to a “rebellion.”

summary: Increased air patrols, air defense systems and other protections will be mobilized over Eastern Europe.

summary: In the messy, public split of the Net-a-Porter founder Natalie Massenet and Erik Torstensson, no accusations seem off limits.

summary: Planning and fund-raising for the “Cultural Olympiad,” the arts programming that is part of the 2028 games, should have been well underway by now, several experts say.

summary: The Missouri Senate passed new borders on Friday that Republicans believe would benefit their party by splitting up the district of Representative Emanuel Cleaver, a Democrat.

title: Marilyn Diamond, Who Wrote a Blockbuster Diet Book, Dies at 81
summary: “Fit for Life,” which she wrote with her husband, was a best seller in the 1980s promoting good health ahead of weight loss. But doctors were critical.
